name: Acolyte
desc: You have spent your life in the service of a Temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world, Performing Sacred Rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine. You are not necessarily a cleric—performing sacred rites is not the same thing as channeling divine power.

Choose a god, a pantheon of gods, or some other quasi-divine being from among those listed in 'Fantasy-Historical Pantheons' or those specified by your GM, and work with your GM to detail the Nature of your Religious Service. Were you a lesser functionary in a Temple, raised from Childhood to assist the Priests in the sacred rites? Or were you a high Priest who suddenly experienced a call to serve your god in a different way? Perhaps you were the leader of a small cult outside of any established Temple structure, or even an occult group that served a fiendish Master that you now deny.

feature.name: Shelter of the Faithful
desc: As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.

You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, if you remain on good terms with it, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

from: I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen.
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.
I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple's elite. Rough living grates on me.
I've spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.

from.desc: Tradition. The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld.
Charity. I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost.
Change. We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world.
Power. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy.
Faith. I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well.
Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god's favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings.

from: I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.
I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.
I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
Everything I do is for the common people.
I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.
I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple's hierarchy.
My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.

name: Amnesiac
desc: You have no memory of who you were before becoming an adventurer. Some event in your past scarred you, mentally or physically. There's something in the back of your mind pulling you toward your past, a constant hint of who you were, but you can never quite put your finger on it.

Maybe you're on a search to discover your past, or you're determined for a fresh start and to rewrite your history. Do you have some sort of unexplained skill or knowledge, or something driving you that you can't explain? What's the first thing you can remember? Or maybe it's all an act, and you secretly remember everything...
other_equipment: A trinket from your past life

feature.name: Déjà Vu
desc: Choose a field of knowledge. You sometimes remember details about this topic without knowing why, and you have advantage on history and insight checks related to this topic.

name: Diabolist
desc: Devil-worshiper. Cultist. Evildoer. You've been called all of these things. You are a servant of some dark force, an evil deity who represents the worst facets of reality. Whoever this patron is, you have a special bond with them that you put above everything else... including your own life.

Choose a being to be your patron. It can be a god from any pantheon, a dark sorcerer, or any other evil force. Think about what made you follow them. Was there an event in your past that made you turn your back on good forever? Are you a member of a group who follows this being, or are you alone in your worship?

feature.name: Fiendish Boon
desc: Your patron is always watching you and will send help in times of need. You can call on your patron for help with a knowledge or insight check, and they may help you if they feel so inclined. But don't be surprised if they ask for something in return...

name: The Mad
desc: A deranged lunatic. An escaped asylum inmate. A maniacal jester. Something in your past left you broken and mentally unstable. Your insanity can manifest as a violation of social norms, a sheer disregard for morals, or the embodiment of pure chaos. Whatever it is, there's something deeply disturbing about your presence.

What event triggered you to lose your sanity? Did you suffer a traumatic loss? Were you kept as a prisoner in nightmarish conditions? Or were you the subject of a horrible experiment? Think about how your character interacts with others and mannerisms they might have.
other_equipment: An antique spoon with a sharpened edge

feature.name: Mania
desc: Any time you roll a 20 on an ability check, skill check, or saving throw, you can choose to instead treat the result as a 1.

name: The Hunted
desc: They are predator, you are prey. You're being hunted by some foe, living in constant fear and staying moving to keep out of their way. It's only a matter of time until they catch you... unless you catch them first.
Who is hunting you? What made you a target? Do you have some special knowledge or a secret they wish to discover? Did you cross the wrong person? Did you betray someone who trusted you?

feature.name: Escape Route
desc: With years of practice, you've learned to always make note of the best way out of a situation. Your intuition can help you locate the best exit from any location you're in, and you have advantage on Investigation checks relating to finding an exit.
